title: What is the best way to learn a new skill or subject? - Quora

response.answer_text: First learn the nomenclature. A nomenclature is the subject domain specific language. You must be able to understand what things are, what things do, and how things interface with each other. You also must be able to communicate intelligently with peers and mentors. Second… master the fundamentals. Unless you are inventing something new, it's been done before. Those who have achieved mastery in the subject domain before you have almost certainly distilled the core elements of success down to a handful of fundamentals, or key tenets. Drill these into your core. Third… perform and measure. You must execute. You can not sit around talking about it. You must go and do it. Do it. You must measure your performance. Nothing builds excellence like measured experience. Doing is mandatory. But doing without measuring the metrics of your performance is to do wastefully. And finally… Teach. Find a student. Be a mentor.

By getting guidance from an expert. Only an expert can tell you the right strategy to master a certain skill. Believe me, this is where most of the people give up. They put an immense amount of hard work and effort, yet they fail. Secondly, once you know the way to achieving mastery in it, practice, practice, and practice. Be ready to be Jared, mocked and humiliated. Be ready to fail. It’s part of the process. Hopefully, with persistent effort and right strategy (again), you’ll learn a certain skill/subject
